content:
Hello!

I just Installed lean on a Windows OS a couple of days ago following the instructions on this page (https://leanprover-community.github.io/install/windows.html) and the videos available with little difficulty, but when I tried to follow the instructions for creating a lean project I have been running into the same issue, where an error message states that commands involving leanproject are invalid. image.png

I've gone through the installation process a few times already, uninstalling and reinstalling python, git bash, etc. but still haven't had any success.

Are there any possibilities for things I could be doing wrong that are fairly common? Thanks in advance!

This just means that the program leanproject is not in any of the directories which your command line is looking in when it's trying to figure out what your commands mean. Are you using the same command line that you used to install mathlibtools? What happens if you just type pip3 install mathlibtools again?

I get a message saying everything's already been installed

image.png
I've been searching for a file that contains 'leanproject' in its name but I'm not getting any results

I found out the issue, I had pip3 installed under python 3.10 but I was using python 3.11 and for some bizarre reason I was able to do everything without errors but all of the packages I had installed were not accessible.

Thanks for the help!
Advaith Vankamamidi has marked this topic as resolved.
